snippet: President Lee Myung-bak predicted a “big change” in the relationship with the North following the death of Kim Jong-il, but warned against provocations.
abstract: South Korean Pres Lee Myung-bak predicts a major change in the nation's relationship with North Korea following the death of North Korean dictator Kim Jong-il; warns against North Korean provocations on the divided Korean Peninsula.
lead_paragraph: President Lee Myung-bak predicted a “big change” in the relationship with the North following the death of Kim Jong-il, but warned against provocations.

headline.seo: President Lee Myung-bak of South Korea Predicts Changes in Peninsula
headline.main: South Korea Predicts Changes in Peninsula
headline.print_headline: South Korea Predicts Changes in Peninsula
